alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 11:02PM CST until February 19 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Alabama, including the following counties, southeastern Jackson and and extreme northeastern Marshall. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1100 PM CST, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scottsboro, Sylvania, Hollywood, Powell, Section, Pisgah, Dutton, Langston, Rosalie and Lake Guntersville St Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
